jamesmisc 0.0.0.9000

Compute exponential growth or decay / compute compound interest

interest.Rd

This function takes an annual return rate, an initial investment amount, and number of years of accrued interest, and returns the terminal amount at the end of the specified period.

Usage

interest(return_rate, initial_investment, years)

Arguments

return_rate

A numeric representing the annual return rate. A negative value would indicate a decay rate.

initial_investment

A numeric representing the initial amount invested.

years

A numeric representing the number of years during which the initial investment grows at the specified return rate.

Value

A numeric representing the terminal amount, after accruing the specified interest over the specified period.

Examples

# How much will you have after 30 years of an intial $10,000 growing at 7% per year?
interest(.07,10000,30)
#> [1] 76122.55
